column5: Just got back from a cottage on beautiful Lake Manitouwabing near Parry Sound.  I stayed at a small resort on one of the many bays.  Such a nice lake.  Didn't matter how hard the wind blows you can always find calm water (unlike Simcoe).  Anyway, I have 3 small children so we did a bunch of panfish fishing and we caught a bunch but I don't fish as I am too busy taking off fish and putting on worms.  Between eating and taking kids for tube rides, I managed to get out fishing 5 times by myself for 2-3 hours at a time. It took me a day to figre out what would work and where the fish were.  I am not much of a walleye guy so I didn't even try for them.  I don't really target pike either (got a few by accident), but I do like the bass.  Overall it was a very good week and once I figured out the bass I managed to get about a dozen per outing.  Unfortunately I forgot my net at home and it cost me on 3 occasions.  I lost a 4+ pound largie at the boat while trying to lip it, another decent largemouth at the boat and another huge smallie.  doh!  My boat isn't exactly fishing friendly but hey, beggers can't be choosers.  enjoy  Here is the cottage  Setting the boat up  Boat on dock  Little Pike  Another little hammer handle off the dock  Ok now onto the bass First bass was a smallie (how fitting)  Nice clean Largemouth  Even better Largemout 2.6 pounds  This picture is dedicated to Simon (Limeyangler) due to the blurr. haha  Another nice clean smallie  Nice Largemout  Best Largemouth of the trip  Best fish of the trip 21" smallmouth (note how wet I am trying to lip the fish off my ladder on the back of my boat.
Chris, nice fish, especially that 21"smallie!  Nothing wrong with five 2 -3 hour fishing stints in a week at the cottage!
Nice report and pictures. That looks like a mean smallie. Looks like the "family" boat is working well for you, good to see!   Thanks for sharing, MTBF
some great pics of the fish bro... thanks
Great report! That cottage looks very cool (I love interesting layouts like that one). Any interior shots? Thanks, Jim
Very nice inside click on the cottage called 'Boathouse' http://www.glenwoodresort.ca/interactivemap.html
nice to see that lake producing some good bass again.  Great report!  Cheers!

Looks like a nice place .I can relate to fishing with my kids I also have 3 and on many occasions when there were little I could not fish either taking off worms taking off fish oh and lets not forget the tangles.Nice tube I just bought a double tube the kids loved it.  Nice bass by the way
Nice Job!  You definitely caught some lunkers.
I stayed at a place there bout 25 years ago called Glenwood cottages---kinda looked like that place---Maybe it has new owners?  Lotsa fun  Bushart

Ah ,that would explain why you werent on my spots out here.LOL  Nice fish there dude.  Off this week for some cottage on the water and try some fishing.  It was a washing machine out there today.    TFS.
Great report and fish.  That is a nice cottage for sure.  Great pictures, except for the Limeangler blurred one  Joey
Great report and pics Chris You got yourself into quality bassin for the short outings you managed by yourself Got your PM Great job mon chum!!! and thanks for sharing Jacques
Yes, that is Glenwood cottages.  New owners for the past 6 years.  Renovated several cottages and doing some more this year.
How is it fishing out of a Bowrider?  Looking to get a boat/family boat.
Great report. I always heard great things about that lake. Looks like you got em pretty good. Thanks for the report.

It is not ideal but a boat is much better than no boat.  I can't complain at all but would love to have a bow mount electric. It is a bit tough to land fish without a net as it is quite deep.  That will teach me to forget my net at home when i go to a cottage.
